intro: Jacquemontia corymbulosa, commonly known as the showy morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink, purple, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Jacquemontia corymbulosa is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing or trailing growth habits.
